intro: Rhaponticoides africana, commonly known as African rhapontic, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Rhaponticoides africana is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for insects and small animals.
